biography.bio: Romy Schneider was born on 23 September 1938 in Vienna, Austria into a family of actors. Making her film debut at the age of 15, her breakthrough came two years later in the very popular trilogy Sissi (1955). Her mother, supervising her daughter's career, immediately approved Romy's participation in Christine (1958), the remake of Max Ophüls's Liebelei (1933), where Magda Schneider once starred herself. During the shooting, she fell in love with her co-star Alain Delon and eventually moved with him to Paris. At that time, she started her international career collaborating with famous directors such as Luchino Visconti and Orson Welles. After Delon had broken up with her in 1964, she married Harry Meyen shortly after. Although she gave birth to a boy, David-Christopher, their relationship was difficult, so they divorced in 1975. Being unsatisfied with her personal life, she turned to alcohol and drugs, but her cinematic career -especially in France- remained intact. She was the first actress, receiving the new created César Award as "Best Actress" for her role in That Most Important Thing: Love (1975). Three years later, she was awarded again for A Simple Story (1978). After a short marriage to her former secretary Daniel Biasini, being the father of her daughter Sarah Biasini, she suffered the hardest blow of her life when her son was impaled on a fence in 1981. She never managed to recover from this loss and died on 29 May 1982 in Paris. Although it was suggested she committed suicide caused by an overdose of sleeping pills, she was declared to have died from cardiac arrest.
biography.name: Romy Schneider

biography.bio: Magda Schneider was born on 17 May 1909 in Augsburg, Germany and a singer, stage and film actress. After her graduation at a monastery school, she studied stenography and office management at a business school, but also attended ballet lessons and art courses at the Augsburg School of Music. Six months later, she gave her stage debut as soubrette at the Gärtnerplatz- Theater in Munich and was discovered by Ernst Marischka, who offered her a role at the Theater an der Wien in Vienna. After her film debut Boycott (1930), she was type casted as the simple girl, dreaming of a happy life in movies such as Two in a Car (1932) or Ein Mädel wirbelt durch die Welt (1934). In 1933, she got to know Wolf Albach-Retty, whom she married four years later. Their children Rosemarie (aka Romy Schneider) and Wolf-Dieter were born in 1938 and 1941, but they divorced in 1945. After World War II, she appeared on stage and screen again, but was better known as ambitious mother, who urged on the career of her daughter Romy. In the 1950s, she played her mother or aunt in several movies such as When the White Lilacs Bloom Again (1953) or Sissi (1955). In the last years of her life, she had to bear the death of her grandson David in 1981 and her daughter Romy in 1982. She died on 30 July 1996 in Berchtesgaden, Germany.
biography.name: Magda Schneider

biography.bio: Gretl Schörg was born on January 17, 1914 in Vienna, Austria-Hungary as Margarete Schörg. She is known for her work on Mam'zelle Cri-Cri (1955), La Chanson du vin nouveau (1953) and Woe to Him Who Loves (1951). She died on January 4, 2006 in Vienna, Austria.
biography.name: Gretl Schörg

biography.bio: Susi Nicoletti was born on September 3, 1918 in Munich, Germany as Suzanne Emilie Luise Adele Habersack. She was an actress, known for Confessions of Felix Krull (1957), The Harmonists (1997) and On the Other Side of the Bridge (2002). She was married to Häusermann, Ernst. She died on June 5, 2005 in Vienna, Austria.
biography.name: Susi Nicoletti

biography.bio: Adrienne Gessner was born on July 23, 1896 in Schottwien, Austria-Hungary as Adrienne Geiringer. She was an actress, known for Tales from the Vienna Woods (1979), La grande roue (1961) and La famille Trapp en Amérique (1958). She was married to Ernst Lothar. She died on June 23, 1987 in Vienna, Austria.
biography.name: Adrienne Gessner

biography.bio: Hans Moser was born on August 6, 1880 in Vienna, Austria-Hungary as Johann Julier. He was an actor, known for Hallo Dienstmann (1952), Einmal der liebe Herrgott sein (1942) and Der Herr im Haus (1940). He was married to Blanca Moser. He died on June 19, 1964 in Vienna, Austria.
biography.name: Hans Moser

biography.bio: Paul Hörbiger was born on April 29, 1894 in Budapest, Austria-Hungary. He was an actor, known for The Third Man (1949), Liebelei (1933) and Nuits de Vienne (1939). He was married to Josefa Gettke. He died on March 5, 1981 in Vienna, Austria.
biography.name: Paul Hörbiger

biography.bio: Son of Siegfried Breuer. Grandson of Vienna's Opera Singer Hans Breuer. Father of Jacques Breuer & Pascal Breuer.
biography.name: Siegfried Breuer Jr.

biography.bio: Gunther Philipp was born on June 8, 1918 in Maroshévíz, Hungary, Austria-Hungary as Gunther Placheta. He was an actor and writer, known for Banana Joe (1982), Das Fenster-Theater (2002) and Unsere tollen Tanten (1961). He was married to Gisela Kirchberg, Monika S., Anna-Maria Huber and Friederike Mayrhofer. He died on October 2, 2003 in Bonn, North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany.
biography.name: Gunther Philipp

biography.bio: Josef Meinrad was born on April 21, 1913 in Vienna, Austria-Hungary as Josef Moucka. He was an actor and director, known for Pater Brown (1966), Sissi (1955) and Sissi impératrice (1956). He was married to Germaine Renée. He died on February 18, 1996 in Großgmain bei Salzburg, Austria.
biography.name: Josef Meinrad

biography.bio: Wolfgang Lukschy was born on October 19, 1905 in Berlin, Germany. He was an actor and director, known for A Fistful of Dollars (1964), La femme de mes rêves (1944) and Dead Eyes of London (1961). He was married to Viktoria von Schack-Lukschy. He died on July 10, 1983 in West Berlin, West Germany.
biography.name: Wolfgang Lukschy

biography.bio: Fritz Imhoff, born as Friedrich Jeschke, studied at business college before taking singing and art courses. As a singer, he appeared in 1912 at the Stadttheater bei Wien. From 1920 to 1928, he played at Wiener Johann-Strauss-Theater; then six years at the Theater an der Wien, and from 1934 till 1938, at the Volksoper and in Cabarets and Varietés. In 1939 to 1944, he played at the Raimund-Theater and worked also there as the director till 1948. He began silent movies in 1929 and made more than 100 movies during his life. He had good parts in all of his Films, but some of his funny once were in La Chanson du vin nouveau (1953), Premier avril an 2000 (1952), Black on White (1943) ("Black on White"), Trip Acquaintance (1943) ("Trip Acquaintance"), Aimé des dieux (1942) ("Whom the Gods Love") and Hotel Sacher (1939).
biography.name: Fritz Imhoff

biography.bio: Heinz Conrads was born on December 21, 1913 in Vienna, Austria-Hungary. He was an actor, known for Die Bekehrung des Ferdys Pistora (1964), Tingel Tangel (1963) and Das Spiel vom lieben Augustin (1960). He died on April 9, 1986 in Vienna, Austria.
biography.name: Heinz Conrads

biography.placeOfBirth: St. Pölten, Lower Austria, Austria-Hungary [now Austria]
biography.bio: Richard Eybner was born on March 17, 1896 in St. Pölten, Lower Austria, Austria-Hungary. He was an actor, known for Sissi (1955), Sissi impératrice (1956) and Das Mädel aus der Vorstadt (1967). He died on June 20, 1986 in Vienna, Austria.
biography.name: Richard Eybner

biography.bio: Karl Schwetter was born on January 18, 1914 in Vienna, Austria-Hungary. He was a production manager and producer, known for Hallo - Hotel Sacher... Portier! (1973), Ringstraßenpalais (1980) and Marry Me, Cherie (1964). He died on April 26, 2002 in Vienna, Austria.
biography.name: Karl Schwetter
